    Pierre-Antoine Thouvenin

    Assistant professor, Centrale Lille

    • Lille, France
    • LinkedIn

    Resume

    Scientific experience

    Sept. 2019 - today Assistant professor at École Centrale de Lille, Centre de Recherche en Informatique, Signal et Automatique de Lille (CRIStAL), Lille, France.
    Sept. 2017 - Aug. 2019 Research associate at Heriot Watt University, Institute of Sensors, Signals and Systems (ISSS), Edinburgh, United-Kingdom.
    Research in hyperspectral imaging and calibration for radio-interferometry, conducted within the Biomedical and Astronomical Signal Processing (BASP) group under the supervision of Prof. Yves Wiaux.
    Jan. 2018 French qualification to serve as an assistant professor in Signal Processing.
    [Qualification aux fonctions de maître de conférence, section CNU 61 (Génie Informatique, Automatique et Traitement du Signal)]
    2014 - 2017 Ph.D. degree in statistical signal and image processing
    Institut de Recherche en Informatique de Toulouse (IRIT), University of Toulouse, France.
    Advisors: Prof. Nicolas Dobigeon and Prof. Jean-Yves Tourneret
    Title: Modeling spatial and temporal variabilities in hyperspectral image unmixing
    Keywords: Hyperspectral unmixing, source separation, variability, non-convex optimization, online algorithm, Bayesian inference, MCMC algorithms, distributed algorithms
    Funding: Direction générale de l'Armement, French ministry of Defense.
    2014 Research internship
    "Modeling spectral and spatial variabilities in hyperspectral image unmixing"
    Institut de Recherche en Informatique de Toulouse (IRIT), France
    INP - ENSEEIHT - Toulouse (France)

    Academic background

    2014 - 2017 Ph.D. in "Signal, Image, Acoustics"
    Institut National Polytechnique de Toulouse (INPT), France.
    2014 Master of Science in "Signal, Image, Acoustics"
    Institut National Polytechnique de Toulouse (INPT), France.
    2014 Engineering degree in Electronics and Signal Processing
    INP - ENSEEIHT Toulouse, France.

    Awards

    Dec. 2017 Prix Léopold Escande
    Institut National Polytechnique de Toulouse (INPT), France
    Distinction awarded to the best PhD theses defended at INPT between Nov. 2016 and Nov. 2017 (15% of the theses defended).
    Oct. 2014 Prix de l'Institut National Polytechnique de Toulouse
    Institut National Polytechnique de Toulouse (INPT), France
    Distinction awarded for outstanding academic achievement during the engineering degree.
